column1: good length at off stump, slight shape away, punched on the up to mid-off
good length at off stump, gives it the charge and lifts it over mid-off as the bat turns in his hands
back of a length on the pads, glanced to short fine's left
bouncer at off stump, sways away and drops his wrists to let it go

what a catch! Bouncer angled down the leg, goes for the hook, gets a glove. It flies high to Sanga's right but he's leaped and held on with his right hand. He was still in the air as he took it, full stretch
good length outside off, careless waft at it without any feet, beaten
full outside off, driven back to the bowler
good length at off stump, goes back and pushes it to deep midwicket
good length, sliding away from outside off, lets it go
good length outside off, swept to deep square's left
good length, slid across from off stump, chopped straight to backward point
good length outside off, gets on one knee and nails the slog sweep right off the middle and straight into the empty spectator area at the midwicket boundary
good length in the corridor, squares him up with the angle, defended to point
bouncer, down the leg side, lets it go
short at the chest, miscues the pull shot and it goes off his body to short fine
back of a length outside off, tries to chop it between first slip and short third and gets it straight to slip
bouncer at middle, he's late on the pull shot, gets a top edge but it lands well wide of Pollard at mid-on
148 kph, full at leg stump, attempted flick raps him on the pads and rolls down to fine leg, phew that was quick
back of a length in the corridor, arches backwards and ramps it neatly over short third man
back of a length in the corridor, pushes straight to backward point off the back foot
short and wide, waits for it and finds the gap between backward point and cover point
back of a length outside off, dabbed to short third man
good length, fired down the leg side

full slower ball, sees him coming down the track, bowls it full and wide, he's nowhere near it and can't even attempt a shot. that's a poor call from the umpire. It pitched and turned back well inside the wide marker
back of a length at middle, tries to heave this behind square on the leg side, gets an inside edge onto body into off side infield
short and wide, stands on his toes and slaps it in front of cover point
bouncer at middle, gets nice bounce and carry past Zaman's attempted hook
good length, angled across the right hander from middle stump, plays close to the body and pushes it to extra cover
short and at the batsman's mid-riff, nudged towards midwicket off the back foot
Baz steps out, gets followed down the leg side with a slower bouncer, has to sway away from it in the end, good direction on the bouncer
short at middle stump, makes room and nails the cut shot this time, but it's straight to Imad at backward point who is pumped up and seems to have something to say very audibly
back of a length at middle stump, clears the front leg and slap-slogs it over midwicket, one bounce
slower ball, good length at middle stump, makes room and slaps it to covers
back of a length outside off, backs away to slice it through, but is beaten on the outside edge with his attempted cut

back of a length outside off, angled across, Zaman didn't need to do too much - all the fielders are in on the off side. But his eyes have lit up, hands have hardened and he's slapped it on the up straight to backward point at face height
wide of the crease, short of good length outside off, walks across and pushes it wide of mid-on
back of the hand slower ball, dropped short outside off, hangs back and pulls it to deep square
good length, angled in at off stump, closes the face too early as he tries to nudge this into the leg side, leading edge doesn't fly too far
back of a length outside off, back foot defence
goes around, bowls short and wide, he throws his hands at it, gets it off the bottom but there's still enough pace on it for it to fly past point
good length at middle stump, pushed to covers off the back foot
good length at the pads, pushed to deep midwicket
back of a length outside off, gets on top of the bounce and opens the face to run it down to third man
back of length at middle, back foot defence
slower ball, back of a length at middle, goes for the pull, badly timed, gets it in front of deep midwicket
classy! Tossed up outside off, steps out, makes room, and launches it inside-out over extra cover
full toss at off stump, punched to deep midwicket
full outside off, vicious cover drive that should've been stopped by cover, who has dived over it...bad effort
dropped short at middle, hangs back and pulls it between the fielders on the leg side boundary
good length outside off, front foot defence
good length at off stump, grips, turns and bounces, gets it high on the bat as he plays a forward defence
full outside off stump, driven to long-on
good length at middle, goes back and pushes it from in front of his pads to deep midwicket
good length outside off, steps out early and checks his shot. Rides the turn and pushes it to point
good length at off stump, steps out and punches to long-off
good length at middle stump, pushed back to the bowler
drags it down the leg side but he hits the pull shot straight to short fine - just needed to get it on either side of that fielder for a four
tossed up at leg stump, driven to long-on
full at off stump, hangs back, clears the front leg and drills it aerially, straight to sweeper cover
steps out early, beaten in flight, pushed to point
tossed up at middle stump, steps out and thumps it back past the bowler's right. Babar run's to his left and misses with his hands but stops  with his legs

tossed up at middle stump, goes for the slog sweep, gets it off the bottom of the bat and it's sliced towards Babar at long-on, who doesn't need help from his feet this time other than to run a few yards to his left to get under that - safely pouched
good length outside off, defended off the front foot
full at leg stump, punched towards long-on, Malik reckons Akmal blocked him as he tried to field that, but he didn't even move, no controversy
good length at the pads, pushed to short fine, would've been out with a direct hit
good length, looped outside off, draws him in for a drive but he isn't to the pitch, Misses, back leg drags slightly as Sanga whips the bails off...sent upstairs...and it looks like he's in. Not-out.
good length outside off, this time he charges at it and gets an outside edge that flies over point who has walked in too far. Short third man runs behind him and sweeps up
full at the pads, turned off the wrists, straight to short fine
short at the leg stump, pulled straight to deep square
full at leg stump, leans forward and turns it into the leg side
good call! Tossed up at off stump, takes one step towards the ball and lifts it cleanly over Pollard at long-on
good length outside off, goes deep and punches off the back foot to covers
full at middle stump, heaved to deep midwicket
good length at off stump, leans in and drops it in front of short third man. It's always close with a direct hit for Narine, but they've misfired yet another throw

tossed up at middle, attempted googly. This time he doesn't even have to take a step towards it - stays put, gets the bat above his shoulder and brings down a neat arc to make Pollard turn around and look for the ball again at the long-on boundary
full at middle stump, tucked to midwicket's right
good length at middle stump, pushed in front of extra cover
full at the pads, turned to short fine with soft hands

and that's the end of the show. Steps out, but Malik has dropped it short in anticipation. It's outside off and spins away as he tries to hit on the up and gets a thick outside edge to Imad Wasim at point
full on the pads, pushed to deep square
good length outside off, pushes forward and pokes at it expecting it to go on with the angle, but it spins back and into the big gap between bat and pad
...turns out Akmal is not happy to just hang in there. Tossed up at middle, shapes to lift this over midwicket, slightly squared up, gets it off the bottom and chips an easy one to long-on
back of a length at off stump, turns away slightly, cut to point
good length outside off, goes forward and follows the spin with his hands to poke it to point
good length at off stump, the slip is out and so obviously he gets an outside edge this time...rolls to short third man's left and he puts in a slide
good length at middle stump, sweeps it on the up, flat and one bounce to deep midwicket
good length at middle stump, swept along the floor to deep midwicket
full outside off, gets low and drags it with a sweep, straight to square leg
good length at middle, gets slow and sweeps it to long leg

another collapse? full at off stump, walks across and tries to get under this to try and slog it over the midwicket boundary, it's too full, there's no room for him and it lobs up for Usman at square leg to run a few yards to his left and take it in the infield
full at off stump, leans forward and pushes it to deep midwicket
good length at leg stump, pushed into the open leg side
back of a length outside off, spins back in, he goes deep and bunts it into the off side
back of a length on the pads, tucked into the midwicket region, looking for two but Amir gets across quickly
back of a length outside off, dropped into the off side off the back foot
back of a length at middle stump, wants to whip this into the leg side but it thumps him on the back thigh
full at leg stump, jammed out to deep midwicket's left
145 kph, hurries onto his pads from a good length, jumps up and tucks it to short fine
back of a length at middle stump, turns it to fine leg off the back foot
good length outside off, goes for the sweep, it's rising at him and gets the top edge. Sohail Khan isn't quick at he runs to his right from short fine and he can't get there
good length on the pads, pushed to square leg off the back foot
full on the pads, gets low and sweeps straight to short fine
dropped short, moves around too much and jams himself as he plays a pull shot and just gets it past square leg
good length outside off, mistimed cut straight to point
oh dear, just had to bowl one more to seal a great spell, but he's gone for the quicker one, short, fast and well down the leg side
tossed up outside off, waits for it and slices it uppishly, one bounce to short third man
back of a length at off stump, goes deep and swings hard at this, gets it high on the bat and it flies over the square leg boundary
back of the hand slower ball, short and wide, slapped straight to point
slower ball out of the back of the hands again, hangs back and pulls it to deep square
bouncer angled across off stump, goes for the hook, gets a top edge and Usama runs backwards from short fine and runs circles before dropping it. Difficult chance, that went high
bouncer outside off again, this time he gets on top of the bounce and slaps it in front of square on the off side...runs back almost two-thirds of the pitch for the second but is sent back by Rizwan
full at leg stump, walks across, gets low and uses the angle to ramp it over short fine. Good shot.
full at off stump, stays in his crease and goes for the slog, but his weight is going backwards as he's barely leaned forward. Couple of bounces down to long-on
141 kph, yorker at leg stump, pushed to deep square
short and angled into his chest, hangs back and pulls it past fine leg with the angle
brings mid-off into the circle and bowls a length ball outside off, Tanvir accepts it and hits on the up over extra cover
yorker at middle stump, clears the front leg and whips it out to deep midwicket

full toss at off stump, shapes to ramp it fine, see the angle and flips the bat to try and find the third man boundary insted. In the end, the ball hits the bat, not the other way round, and it crawls through the square leg region
full at middle stump, goes for the slog, once more he stands tall and doesn't lean in, gets it on the bottom and it goes without too much power to deep midwicket
slower ball, full on the pads, tries to flick it behind square, catches an inside edge on the pads and it rolls into the gully region
what a shot! Yorker at off stump, gets low, keeps his eyes on the ball and reverse ramps it past short third man
yorker at off stump, digs it out to mid-off
yorker at off stump, punched down to long-on
full at off stump, steps out and gets a thick inside edge to square leg
back of a length outside off, thick outside edge on his poke off the back foot, flies past backward point
good length at the pads, it's that old elegant backlift. Comes down at the ball and tucked past short fine
good length at off stump, lets it go with the angle
back of a length in the corridor, pushes it to slip's right with soft hands
there's grace at the other end as well! Full at middle, shuffles across slightly, gets his head over the ball, maintains balance and uses his wrists to drive it through wide mid-on
good length at middle stump, slight shape back in, offers the full face and pushes to mid-on
full outside off, pushed back to the bowler
back of a length outside off, chops it off the back foot to third man
short and wide, goes for the cut, gets an inside edge and Rizwan stops it diving low to his left
back of a length outside off, goes on the back foot and slaps it in front of square
good length at off stump, whipped behind square on the up
wow. Too easy. Good length outside off, clears the front leg and uses the pace to slice it over point on the up
back of a length outside off, gets on top of the bounce and punches it between cover and point
slower yorker outside off, digs it out
back of a length at off stump, shuffles cross and punches of the back foot to deep square's left
back of a length at middle, shuffles across and turns it to short fine
good length at middle, takes a step outside leg, and lifts it over point on the up for third man to run wide and cut off

Rizwan you beauty! Slower ball, good length outside off, he picks it, waits for it and dabs it to the right of Rizwan who puts in a dive to stop the ball. Mahela takes off for a run but is sent back. Can't make it as Rizwan releases immediately and hits the stumps direct from about 15 yards, didn't even take off his gloves for that throw
full at middle, driven to deep midwicket
full at off stump, driven all along the ground to a very wide long-off
good length, offspinner at off stump, turns back in, inside edge onto the pads and balloons towards the short leg region
close! Seam up ball, tails in slightly, goes for the flick down the leg side, Rizwan appeals loudly. There was a sound, but it turns out it was the pad. Good decision not to give that.
good length, pitches on leg and spins down further
good length, leg cutter at middle stump, forward defence
good length at middle stump, clipped through the leg side

this one is even closer! Good length, angled in at off stump, nips back, goes past the inside edge and catches the back pad through to Rizwan. That looked out in real time, but evaded the inside edge. Another good decision
back of a length at middle, glanced off the hips through the leg side
back of a length at middle, defended off the back foot
back of a length outside off, pushes it on the up to third man
back of a length outside off, shapes for the pull shot but checks the shot last minute for some reason. Goes in the air but well in front of deep square
back of a length outside off, driven on the up to covers
back of a length on the pads, pushed to deep square off the back foot
fulll at middle stump, stays put and lifts this over midwicket with no effort
back of a length at off stump, dropped in front of short fine off the hips
back of a length at off stump, dabbed to point
back of a length outside off, dabbed to third man
back of a length outside off, pushed straight to point
good length at middle stump, forward defence
full at off stump, goes inside-out and just flies past McCullum at cover who has stretched and dived about 5000 yards to his right in a half a second
back of a length at middle stump, pushed to deep square
good length outside off, front foot defence
tossed up at off stump, flicked straight to midwicket
good length at middle, pushed to deep square off the back foot
good length outside off, cut straight to point
<>ooo! Flighted at middle stump, draws him forward, beats him in flight and turn. flies past his outside edge
back of a length outside off, punched to sweeper cover
short at middle stump, pushed to deep square
good length outside off, this time he lets it spin by and lets it go
full at off stump, cover drive, Baz puts in another dive there but he wasn't very close, sweeper has to run to his left
full at middle stump, backs away to drive it to long-off
flighted at off stump, goes down the track and drives to long-on
good length at off stump, steps out and pushes back to the bowler
back of a length at off stump, pulled wide of long-on
good length outside off, steps out, not to the pitch, wants to tuck it through midwicket, closes the face too early and gets a leading edge that flies over the bowler
full at leg stump, punched to long-on
good length at off stump, shuffles across and punches on the up to deep midwicket
full toss at the pads, gets low and lifts it over short fine
short and wide, hangs back and cuts it between backward point and short third man
full outside off, whipped into the leg side, wide of long-on
slower ball, good length at leg stump, gets on one knee to ramp it fine, it flies over leg stump
good length outside off, shapes up and slogs it past deep midwicket's left
good length at middle, gets slow and middles the sweep nicely, one bounce to long leg
looped at off stump, he thought it would be fuller, goes inside-out to pick the cover boundary, doesn't get to the pitch and gets a thick outside edge that flies past sweep
good length at off stump, steps out and yorks himself
another loopy ball at leg stump, not to the pitch once again, closes the face early and leading edge goes above Yasir
good length at off stump, taps it back to the bowler

Sanga is also beaten in flight. Steps out and has to get his pad across to cover the line of this good length ball. Gets an inside edge onto pad and it lands safely between bowler and midwicket who converge
short and wide, cut straight to deep cover
goes around, good length, pitches outside off and spins it a mile away. Rizwan has to dive to catch that
short and wide, he's making room but the ball is spinning away and out of his reach. Tries to hit the cut too hard, gets a top edge and point gets under it and takes it easily
back of a length outside off, late cut dabbed past first slip
this one comes back in and gets an inside edge onto pad on the attempted late cut
good length at off stump, defended off the back foot
back of a length, pitches on middle and spins down the leg
good length at leg stump, raps the pads, bobs up and they appeal for a catch after Rizwan takes it, no bat
short and past the wide marker...not given
good length outside off, dropped into the off side off the back foot
good length outside off, no feet, throws his hands at it on the up and goes for the extravagant...but it's gone high, not far, and straight to long-off
good length outside off, angles in and turns away sharply to beat the outside edge
back of a length outside off, angled in and turns away again. Why are they playing across? This time he just about manages to push it to long-on against the turn
good length at off stump, driven to long-off
full at off stump, driven to sweeper cover
good length at leg stump, tries to turn it into the leg side, leading edge back to the bowler
back of a length outside off, pushed to point who has a shy and get a direct hit...third umpire has been called for. He's well in. They got an extra run off the ricochet as well

good length at off stump, dropped into the off side towards short third man off the back foot, this time Bopara is sent back and the direct hit catches him short! Gohar, the substitute fielder. No need of a third umpire this time. Brilliant fielding. It was Bopara's call and he ran, but Malik wasn't looking or listening
short and wide, chopped to point
good length at middle stump, front foot defence
one step, two step, seam up, short ball, down the leg, lifts it easily over short fine
tosses up an offspinner, slow at middle stump, driven back to him
full and floated down the leg side
floated at middle stump, really slow, inside edge onto pad off the attempted slog
dropped short outside off, goes across, gets the toe end of the bat as he pulls it over the bowler
full at off stump, driven to long-off
tossed up nicely on leg stump, this time he waits for it, gets under it and slams it high into the sky and past the long-on boundary
back of a length at off stump, pushed off the back foot to short third man

good length, fired down the leg side, he's used the reverse sweep to drag it out to point...direct hit! There was good bat on that reverse sweep, so it flew to the fielder - Yamin - and he caught and released it in no time to destroy the stumps. Malik hadn't even started his despairing dive as it crashed into the stumps
full at off stump, driven to long-on
full at middle stump, driven back to the bowler
good length at off, spins away as he tries to whip it across the line, checks his shot and taps it back to the bowler
good length outside off, goes with the turn and slaps it on the up over extra cover. Gorgeous
full outside off, stays in the crease, goes inside out and lifts it on the bounce to long-off
yorker at middle stump, slammed down to long-on
full on the pads, flicked out to deep midwicket
slower ball, back of a length at the legs, turned away to deep square leg's left
slam! Floats up a slower ball outside off, he waits for it and lifts it over long-on. Too easy for him. Too easy.
Strong comeback. Yorker at leg stump, tries to flick it, leading edge to point who almost over runs it but manages to retain balance in the end

is that another run out?! Yorker on the boots, flicks it to deep midwicket's right...he runs in, picks up and throws in on the bounce right next to the stumps...but the big man and his big stride have made it past the crease
good length outside off, right in the crunching zone, he crunches alright. But it hits the bottom and bounces over McCullum and straight to long-off
low full toss at off stump, slices it straight to extra cover
is this his night? full at off stump, it's almost like he knows where it's coming. Hangs back, no feet, full face and lifts it over the bowler who has only slightly missed the length there

goes for the bouncer, it's slightly down the leg side, he's missed the pull and is furious with the umpire. He wants a wide. The rules state he isn't right to question the umpire, but outside of the law, everybody sympathizes with Pollard. That was well wide.
yorker outside off, jammed out to long-off
he would've got a wide for this one but he got bat on it. Full toss and well wide, bowled from around the wicket. He can only get the bottom of the bat to long-off

over the wicket, good length outside off, he walks across the stumps to ramp it over short fine, Rizwan moved slightly to his right and had to fall down to stop the ball. Lost time as a result and couldn't get the throw in as they ran past
that's not where to bowl! Overpitched outside off, stands tall and hits yet another one straight over the bowler. Bad length to bowl to Pollard
that's more like it. In the blockhole, wide of off stump, tries to chop it to the off side, beaten
full toss on the pads, whips it past square leg who is inside the circle, deep midwicket comes across but Pollard wants that second more than he wants anything and scampers back easily
gets the length right, gets the line horribly wrong and Rizwan's face tells the story. They have to bowl another ball at Pollard

low full toss outside off, swings away slightly and gets the outside edge on his closed face. It flies over extra cover, to long-off where Akmal runs across to his left, gets down to it and tries to pull out some flair as he does a no-see flick to McCullum who ran back form extra cover...<b>it lands wide of McCullum and they come back for a three for Pollard to keep strike
full outside off, slaps it flat to long-off's left. It's McCullum there this time and he moves nimbly and pushes it back into the ground as his feet shadow the boundary. Great fielding
goes for the bouncer, misses it by some way. Short at middle, he swivels and pummels the pull shot straight to deep square. Pollard is disappointed
full outside off, Pollard has taken off for the run before the ball reaches the other end. Cover drive goes straight to extra cover. Once again, mid-off was in and he's lucky to get away

yorker outside off, Amir has run off like a mad man in celebration. That was baffling. He only turns around and remembers to appeal after he reaches Pollard at the other end. He's just about nailed it inside the wide marker. Pollard has hit the ground with the bat. No edge. Not out.
smashed away! They keep feeding him these overpitched balls outside off, he keeps dispatching them! He knew where it was coming, he held his shape and drilled it to McCullum's left at long-off

he's done it! Overpitched and angled into the pads, he stands tall and whips it with all the Carribbean flair he can muster, watches it sail over the square leg boundary, throws the bat away, throws the helmet away, drops to the floor and does spontaneous push-ups!
